\newpage

# Required Packages


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(modelsummary)
```
:::


# Understanding Missing Values in Regressions


::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
df <- data.frame(wage = c(10, 20, 20, 30, 15, NA, 10, 50, NA, NA, 60, NA),
                 educ = c(1, 2, 3, 4, 8, 5, NA, 6, NA, 5, NA, NA),
                 exp = c(4, 2, 1, 3, 3, 1, 5, NA, 8, NA, NA, NA))
rownames(df) <- str_c("Person", 1:12)
df
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#>          wage educ exp
#> Person1    10    1   4
#> Person2    20    2   2
#> Person3    20    3   1
#> Person4    30    4   3
#> Person5    15    8   3
#> Person6    NA    5   1
#> Person7    10   NA   5
#> Person8    50    6  NA
#> Person9    NA   NA   8
#> Person10   NA    5  NA
#> Person11   60   NA  NA
#> Person12   NA   NA  NA
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
model1 <- lm(wage ~ educ + exp, data = df)             # Data: All 12 observations
model2 <- lm(wage ~ educ + exp, data = slice(df, 1:5)) # Data: First 5 observations
model3 <- lm(wage ~ educ      , data = df)             # Data: All 12 observations
model4 <- lm(wage ~        exp, data = df)             # Data: All 12 observations
```
:::

::: {.cell layout-align="center"}

```{.r .cell-code}
modelsummary(list("Model 1" = model1,
                  "Model 2" = model2,
                  "Model 3" = model3,
                  "Model 4" = model4),
             gof_omit = "R2|AIC|BIC|RMSE|Log.Lik.|F",
             title = "Number of Observations in Data vs in Regression")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
\begin{table}

\caption{\label{tab:unnamed-chunk-4}Number of Observations in Data vs in Regression}
\centering
\begin{tabular}[t]{lcccc}
\toprule
  & Model 1 & Model 2 & Model 3 & Model 4\\
\midrule
(Intercept) & \num{23.986} & \num{23.986} & \num{15.931} & \num{26.500}\\
 & (\num{13.499}) & (\num{13.499}) & (\num{11.818}) & (\num{7.257})\\
educ & \num{0.290} & \num{0.290} & \num{2.059} & \\
 & (\num{1.803}) & (\num{1.803}) & (\num{2.539}) & \\
exp & \num{-2.319} & \num{-2.319} &  & \num{-3.000}\\
 & (\num{4.273}) & (\num{4.273}) &  & (\num{2.222})\\
\midrule
Num.Obs. & \num{5} & \num{5} & \num{6} & \num{6}\\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{table}
:::
:::


**Test yourself:** Please write down the people(observations) taken into account in `model1`, `model2`, `model3`, and `model4`
